result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:35 AM Defendant Ramon Lopez Clavel in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldonado appeared as interpreter and is sworn in.  Atty. Luening provides an update; he needs additional time to resolve the matter but believes the matter can resolve at plea and sentencing.  Court will adjourn for projected plea and sentencing before the Judge assigned to the case in about 30 days.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

08:46 AM Defendant Ramon Lopez Clavel in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldonado appeared as interpreter.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  INTERPRETER NEEDED AT THE NEXT HEARING.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
